results.summary: Police are given more time to question two teenagers arrested after a 15-year-old boy was stabbed to death in a Birmingham park.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/3549750d-86ef-4f42-b3e4-a7fb7678bb33"><image id="68759754"/><paragraph role="introduction">Police have been given more time to question two teenagers arrested on suspicion of murder after a 15-year-old boy was stabbed to death in a fight.</paragraph><paragraph>The clash between two groups of young people happened in a park in Wash Lane, South Yardley, Birmingham on Monday.</paragraph><paragraph>Hassan Mahmood was taken to hospital but died a short time later.</paragraph><paragraph>Four teenagers were arrested after the attack and two later released without charge. Two 16-year-old boys remain in custody, West Midlands Police said.</paragraph><paragraph>Hassan's cousin Asad Hamid said "he died because he was sticking up for his older brother".</paragraph><paragraph>Mr Hamid said: "I don't know how they [the family] are going to carry on living their normal lives.</paragraph><paragraph>"The mother actually fainted a couple of times. It's heartbreaking her losing a son."</paragraph><paragraph>Hassan had been a pupil at the Rightrack independent school in Saltley for six weeks. His headteacher Sohail Aslam said he had settled in quickly and been well-liked.</paragraph><paragraph>Police said they were looking at CCTV footage which may have captured the fight and were appealing for anyone who was in the area at the time to contact them. </paragraph><paragraph>A post-mortem examination was due to take place on Wednesday.</paragraph></body>
results.shortFormBody: <shortFormBody xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/3549750d-86ef-4f42-b3e4-a7fb7678bb33"><paragraph>Police have been given more time to question two teenagers arrested on suspicion of murder after a 15-year-old boy was stabbed to death in a fight.</paragraph><paragraph>The clash between two groups of young people happened in a park in Wash Lane, South Yardley, Birmingham on Monday.</paragraph><paragraph>Hassan Mahmood was taken to hospital but died a short time later.</paragraph><paragraph>Four teenagers were arrested after the attack and two later released without charge. Two 16-year-old boys remain in custody, West Midlands Police said.</paragraph></shortFormBody>

items.summary: Two teenagers are held on suspicion of murder after a 15-year-old boy is fatally stabbed in a park in Birmingham.
items.headline: Yardley stabbing: Boy, 15, stabbed to death in fight
